items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels have risen on the River Loddon as a result of recent rainfall. No further rainfall is forecast over the next few days, and river levels have peaked and are starting to fall. Flooding of low lying roads and farmland is expected to continue especially in the Longbridge Mill area. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated this evening, 14/07/21, or as the situation changes.

Following the heavy rain which was recorded at Wroxall yesterday, the water level in the Eastern Yar continues to fall at Alverstone. At Sandown, the level is just beginning to lower. Today (Tuesday 13/07/21), there may be some minor out of bank flooding affecting fields along the Yar Valley. However, over the next 5 days, the weather should be warm and dry, and this will give the river time to return to a more typical summer level. It also offers the surrounding land time to dry out. As such, no further flooding is expected.

Following the heavy rain which was recorded at Bishopâ€™s Waltham yesterday, the water level in the River Hamble remains high, but it continues to fall. Along the length of the River Hamble, residual flood impacts to land and some roads will continue over the next day or so. The river is unlikely to return to a more typical level until later on Tuesday evening (13/07/21). Over the next 5 days, the weather should be warm and dry, and as a result, no further flooding is expected.
